Class Deck

  • java.lang.Object
    • Deck

  • public class Deck
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    i7461730 Name: Daniel Dimanov Date: 15.12.2015 Task: Assignment 2 Description: This class will be the blueprint for the 6 decks, which blackjack is played with. Every deck will have 52 cards and the deck will store all the ids and all the cards in the deck. Moreover the deck will actually create these ids and then create the cards using them.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Deck()
      This is the constructor method.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void disposeCards()
      This method is mostly used for testing, but can be used to further develop the program and make on every 3 or 4 rounds the cards to be disposed and new cards to be used.
      Card getCard(int index)
      This method returns the Card at given index
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getIds()
      This method gives back all the ids.
      void printCards()
      This method is used mainly for testing and it just prints all the cards in a deck in the console.
      void sgId()
      In this method all the Ids are made.
      void shuffle()
      Pretty straight- forward.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Deck

        public Deck()
        This is the constructor method. It does not take any parameters, but rather uses the ArrayLists, which the whole class has access to. Thus it creates the 52 cards and stores it in the ArrayList and this is essentially the deck.

    • Method Detail

      • sgId

        public void sgId()
        In this method all the Ids are made. Integrated for loop in a for loop is used to determine the value and the general one is for the color(S(Spade),D(Diamond),H(Hearts),C(Clubs))

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle()
        Pretty straight- forward. This method shuffles the deck.

      • disposeCards

        public void disposeCards()
        This method is mostly used for testing, but can be used to further develop the program and make on every 3 or 4 rounds the cards to be disposed and new cards to be used. Anyway not still done in the program.

      • getCard

        public Card getCard(int index)
        This method returns the Card at given index
        Parameters:
        index - used to give the right card
        Returns:
        the card at the given index

      • getIds

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getIds()
        This method gives back all the ids.
        Returns:
        the ids which are really important for the GUI and the right pictures

      • printCards

        public void printCards()
        This method is used mainly for testing and it just prints all the cards in a deck in the console.
